ACTIVITY.SUBTITLE: Inter-VLAN Routing

STEP.DESCRIPTION:
VLANs create broadcast domains.
A host on one VLAN cannot directly communicate with a host on another VLAN.
A Layer 3 device is needed to provide routing between VLANs.
A trunk link can be connected to a router to create inter-VLAN routing.
In this activity the student will trace the path a packet takes through a network with inter-VLAN routing.
Select the path the packet would take from the source to the destination.
Drag the device in the correct order from first to last.
Select no path if no path is available.
When done, click the Check button.
